Group B streptococcus 
Group B streptococcus (also 
called GBS or strep B) is a 
bacterium carried by up to 
30% of people without causing 
harm or symptoms. In women 
it is found in the intestine and 
vagina and causes no problem 
in most pregnancies. In a very 
small number it infects the 
baby, usually just before or 
during labour, and can lead to 
serious illness or death. If you 
have had GBS in a previous 
pregnancy	you
